headline: Nvidia CEO Huang plans to visit China as he seeks to reopen market, Bloomberg reports
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang plans to travel to China in ​late January as he seeks to ‌reopen a critical market for the company's artificial intelligence ‌chips, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a person familiar with the matter.  Huang is expected to attend company events ahead of ⁠the Lunar New ‌Year holidays in February, and may also visit Beijing, according to ‍the report.  Nvidia declined to comment.

headline: Nvidia’s Huang Plans to Visit China as He Works to Reopen Market
summary: Huang will be in the country to attend company parties ahead of the Lunar New Year holidays, according to a person familiar with the matter.  The executive is also expected to visit Beijing, though it’s unclear whether he will meet with senior Chinese officials, said the person, who asked not to be identified because the plans are private.  Huang’s itinerary could still change, depending on whether prospective meetings come through.

content.title: Nvidia’s Huang Plans to Visit China as He Works to Reopen Market
content.summary: Huang will be in the country to attend company parties ahead of the Lunar New Year holidays, according to a person familiar with the matter.  The executive is also expected to visit Beijing, though it’s unclear whether he will meet with senior Chinese officials, said the person, who asked not to be identified because the plans are private.  Huang’s itinerary could still change, depending on whether prospective meetings come through.

headline: Is FICO’s (FICO) GPU-Powered Xpress Upgrade Quietly Rewiring Its Long-Term Moat In Analytics?
summary: Earlier in January 2026, FICO released version 9.8 of its FICO Xpress Optimization suite, integrating NVIDIA CUDA-X libraries to accelerate its hybrid gradient algorithm and delivering much faster solutions for extremely large, dense optimization problems on supported NVIDIA GPUs. This move pushes FICO Xpress further into high-performance computing, widening its appeal for organizations tackling massive, complex optimization workloads across data-intensive operations. Next, we’ll examine how...

headline: US futures edge higher and gold hits another record as markets swoon over Greenland dispute
summary: Asian shares mostly extended their losses on Wednesday and gold prices hit a record high as concerns over U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff threats on Greenland fueled unease among investors.  U.S. futures rose after steep losses Tuesday on Wall Street.  Gold prices crossed the $4,800 mark for the first time, gaining 1.7% as money flowed into assets considered to be safe havens at times of uncertainty.

content.title: US futures edge higher and gold hits another record as markets swoon over Greenland dispute
content.summary: Asian shares mostly extended their losses on Wednesday and gold prices hit a record high as concerns over U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff threats on Greenland fueled unease among investors.  U.S. futures rose after steep losses Tuesday on Wall Street.  Gold prices crossed the $4,800 mark for the first time, gaining 1.7% as money flowed into assets considered to be safe havens at times of uncertainty.

headline: What Rigetti Computing (RGTI)'s Quantum Roadmap Delay and India Deployment Deal Means For Shareholders
summary: In early January 2026, Rigetti Computing revised its roadmap for the Cepheus-1-108Q system, pushing general availability of the 108-qubit, twelve-chiplet modular quantum computer to around the end of the first quarter of 2026 while reaffirming its broader scaling plans. An on-premises 108-qubit system order from India’s Centre for Development of Advanced Computing adds real-world deployment momentum to Rigetti’s modular architecture ambitions. With the Cepheus-1-108Q launch delay and fresh...

headline: Nvidia Invests in AI Start-up Baseten. It Shows a Shift in the Market.
summary: Nvidia  has backed a funding round in artificial-intelligence start-up Baseten.  Baseten helps companies deploy and run large AI models.  The deal comes hot on the heels of Nvidia’s big licensing agreement with Groq, a privately held chip start-up focusing on hardware for AI inference.

content.title: Nvidia Invests in AI Start-up Baseten. It Shows a Shift in the Market.
content.summary: Nvidia  has backed a funding round in artificial-intelligence start-up Baseten.  Baseten helps companies deploy and run large AI models.  The deal comes hot on the heels of Nvidia’s big licensing agreement with Groq, a privately held chip start-up focusing on hardware for AI inference.
